title: Market overview: ECB decision boosts market sentiment
text:
29.11 -0.14 
LONDON (ShareCast) - (ShareCast News) - 1630:Close The top flight index ended the day higher by 42.70 points to reach 6,796.45 led by gains in Weir Group, Pearson (Xetra: 858266 - news ) , Ashtead and Wolseley (LSE: WOS.L - news ) . Gains in shares of the latter two companies were driven by a rising US dollar on the back of somewhat increased interest rate expectations. Market sentiment was boosted by news the ECB had approved new ELA financing for Greek banks and the decision by Eurozone officials to extend bridge financing to the stricken Mediterranean country. 
1500: The Philly Fed's regional manufacturing index slumped to a reading of 5.7 points for July from 15.2 in the month before (consensus: 12.0). 
1410: In a palpably tense press conference Draghi is being forced to repeatedly say that they act under the assumption that Greece will remain a part of the euro area. 
1359: Contrary to earlier reports the European Central Bank did increase its emergency funding for Greek banks, Draghi has said. 
1340: Emerging market slowdown weighing on global outlook. 
1338: Recent market uncertainty has not changed economic outlook, the ECB's Draghi says. 
1330: Initial US unemployment claims declined by 15,000 in the week ending on 11 July to reach 281,000. 
1259: Citigroup (NYSE: C - news ) has reported second quarter EPS of $1.45 (consensus: $1.39). 
1245: ECB has kept all its main policy rates unchanged. 1225: Goldman Sachs (NYSE: GS-PB - news ) saw quarterly EPS excluding litigation costs jump to $4.75 from $3.96 in the year ago period. 
1109: Ashtead Group (LSE: AHT.L - news ) and Wolseley are both gaining on the back of the rising US dollar. Commenting on recent volatility in FX markets, in a research report sent to clients on 15 July analysts at Credit Suisse (NYSE: CS - news ) said: " If volatility continues the company with the most exposure to the Australian dollar is Hays (LSE: HAS.L - news ) , to the Brazilian real is Experian (Other OTC: EXPGF - news ) , to the US dollar is Ashtead and to the Euro (for the non-euro denominated businesses) is Rentokil." 1012: The ECB is said to have kept is ELA funding for Greek banks unchanged, according to Bloomberg. 
0927: PBoC many announce that it will inject capital into the country's Development Bank, one report says citing Bloomberg. Meanwhile, euro/dollar is now lower by 0.40% to 1.0907. Shares (Frankfurt: DI6.F - news ) in Lloyds are up 0.75% to 86.4p even after UKFI announced another percentage point reduction in its stake in the lender to 14.98%. 
0852: UK stocks have started the morning slightly higher, although they are underperforming their rivals over on the Continent. Wall Street took a breather overnight after four days of gains. The Dax-30 on the other hand is on track this morning for a seventh consecutive advance. Both Sterling and the Greenback are trading higher versus the single currency in the early going. Some market commentary, but not all, is suggesting that Yellen's testimony yesterday was more bullish than her remarks on 10 July. Carney is due to deliver another speech tonight, at 19:00, traders will be keen to see if he moderates his tone in any manner. FTSE 100 is up by 24.22 points at 6,777.97.
